cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi NNE of Cabo Lucrecia, Cuba and 105 mi S of Long Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the Bahamas, then paralleling the Florida east coast before curving north-northwest toward the Georgia–South Carolina coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Georgia-South Carolina coast (in the vicinity of Port of Savannah, GA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Flagler/Volusia County line (FL) to Fernandina Beach, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: North Palm Beach, FL to Flagler/Volusia County line, FL (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from eastern Florida through coastal Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (with a 52% cumulative chance) are expected to reach the port late Friday into Saturday; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out (5% chance of 64-kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Matthew tracks just offshore, on-shore flow could push 3–5 ft of surge into the Savannah River and adjacent marshlands, especially around high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches of rain possible Saturday with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood risk in low-lying terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large pounding surf, dangerous rip currents, and possible river flooding may disrupt vessel traffic and terminal operations.
